title: United Nations Attacks Fast Facts
text:
(CNN) Here's a look at violence against UN peacekeeping forces. This is a selected list of incidents from 1990 to present.

Since 1948, the United Nations has authorized more than 70 peacekeeping missions around the globe.

The largest of the current 14 missions is in the Democratic Republic of Congo, with more than 20,000 personnel.

Since 1948, at least 3,866 peacekeepers have been killed in operations.

As of July 31, 2019, there are approximately 99,542 peacekeeping personnel from 121 countries.

Timeline:

1993 - At least 16 peacekeepers are killed in Cambodia, allegedly by Khmer Rouge guerrillas.

September 5, 1993 - Seven peacekeepers from Nigeria are killed in Mogadishu, Somalia, in an ambush by gunmen loyal to Aidid.

May 17, 1994 - Five UN peacekeepers from Five UN peacekeepers from Nepal are killed in a gun battle in Mogadishu, Somalia.

May 4, 2000 - In Sierra Leone, seven peacekeepers from Kenya are killed by rebels.

February 25, 2005 - Seven peacekeepers from Bangladesh are killed in an ambush in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC).

January 23, 2006 - Rebels in the DRC kill eight peacekeepers from Guatemala.

June 24, 2007 - Six UN peacekeepers are killed in southern Six UN peacekeepers are killed in southern Lebanon by a car bomb.

June 8, 2012 - Armed assailants kill seven peacekeepers in the Ivory Coast.

April 9, 2013 - Five UN peacekeepers from India are killed in Five UN peacekeepers from India are killed in South Sudan.

July 13, 2013 - Gunmen ambush a peacekeeping force in the Darfur region of Gunmen ambush a peacekeeping force in the Darfur region of Sudan , killing seven Tanzanian troops.

September 18, 2014 - Five UN peacekeepers from Chad are killed and three others are injured when a UN vehicle hits a homemade bomb in northern Mali.

October 3, 2014 - Nine UN peacekeepers from Niger are killed in an ambush in Mali, when their convoy is attacked near Menaka, in the country's eastern Gao region, by heavily armed men on motorcycles.

July 2, 2015 - Six UN peacekeepers from Burkina Faso are killed and five others are injured when their convoy is attacked in the West African nation of Mali.

May 29, 2016 - Five UN peacekeepers are killed in an ambush in Mali.

May 8, 2017 - Five peacekeepers are killed overnight in the Five peacekeepers are killed overnight in the Central African Republic near the town of Bangassou by a Christian rebel group.
description: Read CNN's Fast Facts and learn about violence against UN peacekeeping forces. This is a selected list of incidents from 1990 to present.
